description:
Really good Hunan food! This location is the best among all chains. The scallions fried eggs and the pork with pepper were fantastic and authentic to the core! Really love them!
This is my to-go place whenever I visit my friends in Airbnb, and my to-go face for spicy food whenever I am in town!
Just authentic Hunan food. Period.
author: Tian G.

description:
No question, the top, authentic, holes in the wall, spicy Chinese food restaurant.

EVERYTHING IS AMAZING!! Even the most simple dish is fantastic!!!

Go try it itself, and put the stereotype away. You will enjoy it!!!
author: Weijia W.

description:
Gave this place a try this week.  Not a good idea.  Ordered the beef with vegetables.  The vegetables were some sliced carrots and chopped cabbage.  Not too much beef in the dish.  There wasn't really any sauce, the dish just seemed oily.

But spending the next morning on the toilet wasn't me idea of fun!
author: Michael G.

description:
Lots of people commented that this place sits Chinese speaking people first. 


- It is WRONG. Whenever my friends and I come, we ALWAYS make a reservation and order dishes beforehand. By the time we walk in this place, all we need to do is to sit down and eat.
author: Zheng Z.

description:
Wow. Don't come here. I stopped in because I have eaten at the other two Henry's and have always loved their food. This is like the hillbilly cousin of Henry's with no teeth and no understanding of why anyone would WANT to have teeth. 

This place greets you with a funny smell when you walk in. The service was beyond detached; it was intentionally unfriendly. (And I'm an "excuse me sir, please and thank you" kind of customer.) There's masking tape over one quarter of the menu; those things aren't available. (Including Harvest Pork, Which is why one should go to Henrys'.) The picture below shows part of the dining room. 

But if you're still undecided, how's this: There Is No Hot Tea. There Is No Hot Sauce. There is just a sad plate of passable chow mein. 

Just don't.
author: Alex C.

description:
My boyfriend and I are big eaters, but couldn't finish either of our dishes because it was not good whatsoever.

Food was either super bland or tasted odd - definitely did not possess any sort of Hunan flavors. The potato dish was sour, the pork was stale and chewy, and the chicken dish was bland. Where are the spices?! Where!!!!

Anyways, easy street parking right across the street from Nordstrom Rack + Trader Joe's
author: Elvi T.

description:
Although I have never been to Hunan Province, my friends told me that this restaurant provides the most authentic Hunan dishes. I highly doubt what they said until I tasted the food by myself. The food is very authentic and good! From time to time, I have the delusion of sitting in a small restaurant in Hunan near the Xiang River, watching people come and go while pondering over my entire life.

If you are a big fan of red and green peppers and want to have a bite of Hunan traditional dishes, this is the place to go. If you are looking for a restaurant with five-star service, clean tables and floors, open your Yelp and find those 4.5+ star Chinese restaurants and order your General Tso's chicken with rice.
author: Chen C.

description: This place discriminates against white folks. I walked in to only be thrown out and was told dinner would take an hour. Of course it sounded like total BS from the start. Don't waste time finding a parking space in this dangerous area because you'll only get in the door to just be told to leave. A very big disgrace to this once vibrant city hell even 1 star is too gracious! Oh, and prepare to get sick eating there because it looked like the obviously lazy staff don't even bother to clean the tables and dishes. They're running a crap joint and oughta be run out of business!
author: Aaron C.

description:
Hard to find authentic Hunan cuisine. The pepper they used is super tasty, very spicy and flavorful. My personal favorite is pickled pepper beef. 

But I need to say they used too much oil in most of their dishes. I wouldn't eat here very often if I want to eat healthier.
author: Wenjing Y.

description:
So sad, really.

I have been going, consistently, to Hunan Restaurants (ever since they were on Kearny Street, in Chinatown, in 1979). Henry, who recently passed, after creating a classic San Francisco institution, would be mortified to see what THIS location of his family restaurant group has come to. 

Upon our arrival, the shabby waiter (as it turned out) was standing outside the front door, smoking. After flipping his cigarette into the street he came inside with us. (That's our waiter?!) We made some effort to have our order understood, in English, as he spoke nearly no English as far as we could discern. Not great for someone in a customer service position. After putting down our order we never saw him at our table-side again. Oh, ... except when I called him over and told him that one dish had been delivered nearly cold. "No, ... hot." He told us, and set the dish back down on the table, and left.

This location, to which I have been many times in the past, is usually very busy at lunchtime. Yesterday, a week day, it was a ghost town. 
Now I know why. 

Besides terrible service, the food was abysmal. It makes me sad to say so, but it's true.They have NO dumplings (signature steamed 'pot stickers") on the menu at all, how is that? One dish that I always order, because it's wonderful, was delivered to our table unrecognizable. I was dark and lifeless; I'm certain it had been previously cooked and reheated to serve. It was very sad.

Green beans were overly fried and blistered, which made them tough.

Do yourself a favor and steer clear of this place and visit their OTHER location on Church Street @ Day Street if you want the original food Henry designed and was so proud of. There they still take pride in the legacy Henry left them. The manager there, Henry's grandson, Jeffrey, and his staff, deliver the home cooking of Hunan we know and love.
author: James G.

description: The last time I went there there were bugs crawling in the corner and the tables weren't clean at all (sticky and rattling and just dirty). I tried this place again because SO (next door) was closed, and they literally ignored all non-Chinese speakers and seated Chinese speakers who came later first.
author: Joanne J.

description:
According to my hunan gf, this place serves authentic Hunan food. I've tried several of their dishes and none of them disappoint. The spices and herbs they add to their dishes creates appetizing food. 

Even walking into the restaurant feels like entering a new country. All the times I've went, all the people were Chinese. 

Dishes that are must tries:

- Farmer's Pork
- Preserved Smoke Pork
- Cucumber Basil
- Beer Duck
author: Jim G.

description: This is the worst place you could ever go for dinner in SF. I've been here many times and my waiting time for dinner really differs, it could actually range from 1 hour to 2 hours to even 4 hours!!!!! How could a restaurant without even showing the least respect to a customer's time still be running! I swear to god if I go to this place ever again please food poison me to death!
author: Linda W.

description: Super authentic hunan food, best I've tried in SF. Only thing is the wait after ordering the food was slightly long.
author: Ruby H.

description:
FIRST AND FOREMOST:
This review is about their Bryant St location.

BUT:
In my memory, their old location on Sansome was iconic. I know it was Chinese for White folk, but that's OK. We had epic lunches there back in the day when the whole area was ad agency row. I still crave Diana's meat pie and that wonderful garlicky and sour chicken rice plate. 

DO YOU KNOW:
They invented the delicious and now-ubiquitous Chinese Chicken Salad. 

THAT SAID:
I had lunch at the Bryant St location and it SUCKED. Tasteless. Greasy. Thoughtless lazy food that wasn't worth the calories. Diana's meat pie was bland ground beef overwhelmed by raw onions, all sandwiched into flavorless fry bread. Blecch.

FWIW:
I packaged up my lunch, largely uneaten, and gave it to some hungry dude on the street -- but apologized for it first. 

SO:
They have a location on Minna near New Montgomery that still delivers the goods. That's the only reason for two stars. I'll go there.
author: Richard L.

description: The worst restaurant I've ever been. We waited 40min after placing the order and there were still zero dish on our table. Everyone who came in after us got their dishes. There is only one waiter and he is rude and lazy. The place is very dirty and chaotic. A complete disaster.
author: Ying N.

description: This place is F awful.  There are 5 tables including mine, and I waited my dishes for more than 30 mins.  If the dishes are very tasty, I could be fine to wait that long. In fact, the dishes are very salty and oily. I do not even want to rate this place because one start rating is still too much.
author: Slu L.

description:
Classic Asian run eatery for Asians. They don't do courtesy well and they don't get the concept of "service" in the same way Americans expect. This is hard to explain, but being Asian I would describe it as a very simple minded way of doing business in a straight forward way. If you don't take it personally, and they do enough, it can be okay.

Asians -- Willing to say this is pretty decent grub. I thought prices were good, it was authentic enough and had some good menu items. 

Non-Asians -- Probably just avoid this place for your own sanity.
author: Jack T.

description:
My WORST dining experience ever. Not "one of", IT IS THE WORST FOR MY PAST DECADES. I was so furious when I got out of this place.

They don't know how to serve clients and that is fine. Evev worse, they don't respect people at all. When we questioned about why the final price on the bill was that high, they were so reluctant to show us the details of the bill. They firstly shouted out to each other "these people don't want to pay", then they carried the calculator with such an attitude to our desk with "I will calculate it for you", followed with "each rice is 1.5, you ordered 8 how much is it" - listen, is it the way you treat your clients? And just a BTW, we just got two large bowl of rice, and I have never seen restaurant charging people for rice in this weird way.

Then I was like "you said you will do the calculation, right? Please". And you know what happened then? The waitress just STARED at me at a second with such a cursy look! I swear to God that is the MOST evil/terrible/intimidating stare I have ever experienced. It was like I had done something un-excuseable to her. I got so infuriated so I had to close my eyes, kept silent, and let my friends deal with it, otherwise I was afraid I would just fight with them. And I am not lying - I took out my phone and was ready to call 911 because the crew there had already crowded our table and we had a girl with us. 

Oh and did I forgot to mention that they charged a dish 35 bucks, which is marked as 25 in their menu? When we questioned, they were like "you have to pay! Everyone else from such a long while ago paid 35!" 

Oh and did I also forget to mentioned that we waited there 60 minutes for our food and the crew there were just sitting in the lobby playing mobile games? [smilence]

To be fair, their food is ok. But trust me, it is not worthy at all because of their terribly-terrible service - unless you are willing to take the risk to destroy your day.
author: Haoxiang L.

description:
Shameful for Henry's family restaurants. Henry was respectful cooker and how come this place under his name as well. 

I came here months ago and it was pretty bad, but decided to give another try beacause it's just downstairs. I waited 90 mins for take out in the restaurant even though they told you it was 40 mins wait. When I asked them when would my orders be ready multiple times, no one answered my questions. The reason kept me waiting is I want to see how slow and bad it could be so that could complete my life. They did it and ruled it.

I knew Chinese restaurant usually do not have good service. But this place is worst of all. It even makes me feel embarrassed if you consider this is typical Chinese restaurant.

Go to other Chinese restaurants for your own sanity.
author: Dylan X.

description:
Real authentic Chinese food! 
Dishes are definitely on the spicy side but this is what real Hunan cuisine is like.
Will definitely return.
author: J D.

description: Born and raised in Changsha, I can vouch for the authenticity of Henry's Hunan. I understand how the one-star and two-star reviews feel about the service - granted it is very lacking, not the best attitude - but the food is so damn good. Flavorful and spicy! The Farmer's Pork isn't as good as other Hunan places in LA or San Diego, but my favorite dish is the pork knuckle. Hands down the best I've ever had, including the ones I've tried in Hunan. I also like the basil cucumber and hand-torn cabbage. Quintessential Hunan food. The Henry's Hunan in FiDi is definitely not as authentic.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Waited for one hour. Other desks who came much later than us got served before us. Staff seemed very impatient.
author: Frank L.

description: spicy is good, recommend egg with chill paper. I really like that dish. everything is good too.
author: Yige X.

description: I waited for 1 hour before I got my first dish. I was hungry, then not hurgry, finally hungry again but still waiting. This is definitely intolerable. Very bad experience.
author: Du Z.

description: I live above Henry's Hunan in Soma. The guy, Jason that runs it. Is rude and has a IDGAF attitude that I consistently deal with, daily. He smokes a foot from the door or sometimes doesn't even step outside and his friends/family do the same thing. He will have friends over that go until midnight or one in the morning. I've had numerous friends that have gone in their over the last couple of years and have had the worst service. That is a reason why I will never give him my business. Plus the negative reviews people have left adds to my reason. Jason you're giving Henry's a bad name
author: Steven T.

description:
Authentic Hunan food, but with a long wait.

Did I mention the wait is long? It's LONG. A typical lunch combo takes 40 min to cook. As in, you have to wait here for 40 min while they cook it. Plan ahead.

The food quality itself is authentic. Although, for my lunch combo double-cooked pork, even though I explicitly asked for spicy, it turned out to be not that spicy at all. The really spicy ones are the separate dishes, not the combos. The dishes are much more authentic than the lunch combos.

Overall, a good place to visit if you are crazing authentic spicy chinese food. Just remember to get the individual dishes, and plan for a long wait.
author: Henry L.

description: Been here couple times. I mean the food is amazing. But the service is the worst. The waiter is so impatient. And so pushy
author: Clancy Y.

description: Can't stand this place. There is ALWAYS some short fat man in gym shorts and a t-shirt smoking right in the front doorway!  Disgusting!!!
author: Steve M.

description:
Me: "We've waited for 30 minutes for our food."

Waitress: "Yeah it'll be a while 'cuz we cook for table after table."

Me: "How much longer do we have to wait?"

Waitress: "Let me check."

(back from the kitchen) Waitress: "It'll be quite a long while."

We were so disappointed, starving, and shocked at the waitress's attitude. We started yelping for restaurants nearby. We planned to just stand up and leave.

And our food came. And it was amazing. 

But that wouldn't change my 1-star rating and the fact that I'd never be back. The whold experience was just way too confusing and somewhat insulting.
author: Shia L.

description:
If possible, I will give this 0 score.

You won't be able to get you food , unless you reserved with your menu over the phone. 

Great, great business model and smart DFS based traversal.  I guess they never care about starvation
author: Bo Z.

description:
Almost called 9-1-1. Waiters made us feel physically unsafe!

We were confused about the total cost and asked politely for the bill. What comes next is ridiculous, the waitress gave us an angry look and rolled her eyes and waiter exclaimed "they don't want to pay" when we mentioned the price is totally different from the menu (1 / 3 higher). The manager came out from kitchen and shouted at us and said they did same thing to others and why we had questions.

We all felt this restaurant is DISGUSTING!!! Keep your dignity and what they have done is illegal!
author: Expo Y.

description: Attention for Chinese people, especially who loves spicy Hunan food. This restaurant, only the Bryant Street one, is the most authentic Hunan food in SF. I've tried other Henry's Hunan but they are not authentic at all. Other Henry's cook for Americans and not spicy. Don't try it. Just go to this location. It's the best. I'll come here again and again. So spicy and authentic
author: Meng D.

description:
Four star for the good but zero for the services. Be careful of the bill as we found them charge more than the price on the menu. The price on the chicken soup is $25 dollars but they actually charge $35!! I literally find no more than 10 pieces of chicken? I would say that should not even price it more than $20.

We noted the bill shouldn't be that high and asked for the details they then tell us the chicken soup is $35 and they have charged other lients for $35 for the past two years! Even though the menu still says $25!! So be careful as they wouldn't even tell you if you don't ask. And what's more rediculous, they accused us of not willing to pay for what we ordered when we say we should only be paying the menu price!! What attitude is that? Besides, they charge $2 for rice for each person but they will just give you a big bowl of rice for your table. If you ask for more after your table finish that big bowl they will charge again for $2 per person. Really had experience and I doubt who would ever want to pay for this attitude???
author: Helena H.

description: Obviously not a legitimate business. Dumpy and dirty. Dirty dishes with half eaten entrees on most of the tables. They wouldn't even look at me much less seat me or take a to go order. Seedy looking patrons. Racist and clearly some front for a criminal element. The guy running the place with the big giant diamond earring didn't seem to know the menu, or any of the prices are even really what the hell was going on. Didn't get a sense that this guy had a whole lot of restaurant experience wink wink
author: Jim L.

description: Horrible service. Sat down and were completely ignored. The manager spent most of the night outside smoking and after we located our server he told us that most vegetarian items were unavailable (including fried rice) and that it would be over 30 minutes to get food. People around us sat down and immediately got service and food. They clearly had preferences for who they wanted to serve.
author: Mr. S.

description: Be aware of being over charged when you come here. The food is not bad, but the service deserved 0 start. I ordered 3 dishes which were 15 for each , ridiculously ended up with the bill of 70 .
author: Adele Y.

description: Food quality has gone downhill. No longer as good as it once was several years ago. Maybe due to chef. Or owner cutting corners. Best to go to Natomas or Samsone Street restaurants.
author: Will L.

description:
We used to love this restaurant when Jeff ran it
The food is ok
They won't make all the dishes at night
And the don't seem to give a shit that you are a customer 
Henry would be embarrassed
author: Karen M.

description: My "Eight delight vegetable" dish was pretty tasty but only had 5 vegetables in it. And mostly boring ones - onions, carrots, cabbage, green beans and a few green bell peppers. I picked out all the onions because I hate them, although they looked nicely charred, and I was left with a half full container. In other words it was half onions, half not particularly delight vegetables. Also, the place is a shambles.
author: Dee K.

description: NEVER AGAIN! Love the original location on Minna street so decided to try this place while stuck on jury duty. With any Henry's  location you have to expect grimy windows and impassive waitstaff;it's part of the charm. What I did not expect was to be told that thay did not have brown rice and only had one of three salads on the menu, nor did I expect to wait over half an hour with an empty water glass and no food. I walked out.
author: Ian V.

description:
Customer service abysmal to the point of disbelief. The phone line was broken (called several times over 10-15 minutes) so I went there in person to order take out. Once there I was warned that the food would take "at minimum" 40 minutes to cook. Asking why resulted in a shrug. When I mentioned the broken phone the woman at the front did not even acknowledge it - most likely it is turned off on purpose. 

How this place keeps the lights on as a Chinese restaurant is beyond me. The food did look good, but there are way too many faster, cleaner, and frankly better alternatives to give this place one cent of my money.
author: Tony W.

description: My partner and I sat down 45 minutes before closing time and the waiter told us it would be a 35 minute wait.  I figured they were just trying to scare us away so that they could close early but he wasn't lying.  In fact they took more like 50 minutes for our food.  After 40 minutes they brought us food and then took it away and gave it to another table.  That was a fun twist to the night.  Service was also terrible.  The waiter made a stink about the 10% tip I gave but my partner wanted to give 0 so that was a compromise.  2 stars because the food was pretty decent...once it arrived.
author: Lance D.

description:
I've been working in the neighborhood forever and have eaten here a ton. This branch of Henry's was great up until a few years ago when the folks in charge there struck out on their own and started up branches in Noe Valley and the Excelsior, both of which are excellent (just so you know). A new team took over at this spot and it began to go downhill. 

Nowadays, the staff here does not seem to give a flying fuck. 

I always ordered for takeout. Typically you expect a place to get your stuff ready in 15 minutes or so. I'd order 15-20 minutes in advance, then show up and have to wait another 15 minutes until they made the food. This was a repeated thing, not a "hey we're busy today give us a break" deal. After a bit the camel's back was broken by a straw and I swore the place off. 

After two years I buckled and ordered from them again and didn't get fucked over or anything. I ordered further in advance and that seemed to work. The food was inconsistent though, to the point where there was one instance that was pretty gross due to an excess of salt. I'm talking gag reflex. Cook must have been smoking crack. You'd think someone wouldn't go back after something like that but the food in this fucking area sucks. Henry's, even now, is better than most places (OK if you wanna spend $20+ on lunch each day there are options but I don't got that kind of money). I have, finally, stopped going to this place and I'll tell you why.

Recently one of the regular guys set himself up a little nook at a table right behind/next to the cash register. He's got his laptop set up there and a bunch of other shit, like some people have at their desk at home. He's got a small papasan chair where he sits to play video games on the laptop during the lunch rush. I've seen him full on ASLEEP there, in full view, when picking up takeout. I figure dude lost his apartment in expensive-ass SF and this is his fall back. 

Here's what occurred to me though--you got this guy living in Henry's Hunan. Not in the back room or anything on a cot, but in the main dining room. He has his computer and home comforts there and is, I'm guessing, single. It stands to reason that this guy probably fucking jacks off to internet porno right at that spot next to the cash register. RIGHT?!

Anyway, I'm no "delicate snowflake" but that kills it for me.
author: Chris K.

description: I love Henry's Hunan but this location isn't my fav. No dumplings at least the last several times I've been there. Other items on the menu aren't available but they don't take them off the menu for some reason, maybe they'll come back? Food still has that nice spicy Henry's flavor but go to the one on NATOMA street if you can. Much better. I do love the Harvest pork and the bean curd with meat sauce amongst my favorites.
author: Chris N.

description:
Granted this wasn't our first choice restaurant, as our MSG craving palates initially wanted to dine at SO next door only to realize it's not open for dinner anymore.  Being lazy, Henry's became the fallback plan.

This place isn't made for the westernized palate.  In fact, I don't think it's made for anyone non-Chinese.  Arrived to meet my friend who pointed out that there were two menus - one in English and the other in Chinese.  Now I've been to restaurants with my Chinese speaking friends and they're always telling me, "you gotta order things not on the menu!"  Secret menus were invented by Chinese restaurants, not In-N-Out.

Neither of us being Chinese but both of us with adventurous food tastes was more interested in knowing what's on the Chinese menu so my friend used her phone to translate all the Chinese characters to English.  We asked the waitress for recommendations so she pointed out pork belly, green beans, and I like my chicken giblets.

Excited to try authentic Chinese food, one bite into everything and I could feel beads of sweat dripping down my forehead.  No amount of white rice I was stuffing my face with could neutralize the spice.  Now I handle spice well but exorbitant amounts of spice in every single dish brought out to us that I can't even taste the difference between the dishes is kinda overkill.  This made me wish we went to Panda Express instead for some orange chicken or Kung pao chicken. 

My friend and I usually love leftovers but we passed on this one.  Maybe I just don't get it when it comes to authentic Chinese food.
author: Bailey N.

description:
So it's gonna be your favourite  
Or it's gonna go down in flames
You can tell me when it's over
If the endorphins high was worth the pain

(I may or may not have a song stuck in my head for too long) 

I've been debating if I should review this place because it's probably the best kept secret in Soma, and I almost don't want to share with others. On the other hand this place is not for everybody (as you can see from some of the reviews)... So I'm probably safe! 

Don't come here if:
- you don't *love* spicy food
- you like Americanized Chinese food more than authentic Chinese food
- you expect the same experience as other Henry's Hunan chains
- you are on a date (it really isn't even remotely romantic) 

Think twice if:
- you are not comfortable in an all Chinese environment
- you consider Sichuan food very spicy 

This place is on a quiet street in SOMA. It has a very humble appearance (looks like it was converted from either a diner or taqueria) with cheap tables and chairs. But if you are an adventurous foodie and want to taste authentic Hunan food, give this place a try, it may just blow your mind.

It may used to be just another Henry's Hunan, but I think the owner has changed. It still has a regular English menu, but they also make authentic Chinese dishes on the side. They weren't used to be on any menu and you have to just know about them, now at least they are written down on a separate menu.

If you aren't Chinese, politely refuse the nicely bound English menu and insist on the handwritten Chinese menu on a small piece of paper. If you can't read Chinese, consider bringing a friend who can, or order from my list: 

Super spicy:
- 小炒肉/pork with peppers. I'm not sure what kind of pepper it is, but it sets my stomach on fire
- 鸡胗/chicken gizzards. Chewy and nicely flavoured 

Very spicy:
- 猪手/pig trotters. Good way to get some collagen! 
- 红烧鱼/steamed whole fish. Covered with chili peppers, but the fish meat is not very spicy without the juice. It's a combination of spicy and sour flavour (from pickled veggies) which I love. 
- 孜然排骨/cumin pork ribs. Needs no explanation but probably one of the best you'd find in the city. 
- 麻辣牛蛙/spicy bull frog. A little boney, but the meat is worth the work of spitting out bones. This is a very popular dish and it often run out. 

Mild:
- 藕片/lotus root chips. Love the crispy texture. It's one of my fav dishes
- 手撕包菜/hand peeled cabbage with chili pepper. Not that spicy but very flavourful (with a hint of vinegar too)

I suggest that you order one from each category. If it gets too spicy, they also sell sweetened milk and it's the best way to overrule the burning feeling. 

Or, you can just look at what dishes your neighbours are getting and demand the same thing. 

The manager (or owner?) Jason is very nice and accommodating. We made a reservation for a large group and placed the order ahead of time. When we got there the table and food were both ready!
author: Rachel Z.

description: R U HUNGRY?????? If so, DO NOT GO!   80min waiting time after you sit down and placed ur order
author: Jian Z.

description:
AMAZING. Yes the service is slow and the food takes super loooooong. BUT, as a hunanese - this is the BEST Hunan food SF has to offer.
It's what a human mama would cook for her kid!!!! Don't understand why some ppl gave such low rating. Lol
People, this is the real shit*. Extremely glad I finally found this place :D
author: Sophie L.

description: We sat down at this restaurant on Saturday night and were told that orders would take a minimum of 35 minutes because they had just accepted a big to go order. We left without eating - clearly if they want to be a restaurant with seated customers they need to re-evaluate their priorities. Beware of this when you go and ask if they are running behind.
author: G M.

description:
The food tastes good. The amount of time taken to cook it is beyond ridiculous. If you don't care about your time, then sure, come here. I've been here 3 times now always hoping it would be better. Each time has resulted in immense regret. On a not so busy night, you have to wait 1h+. On a busy night, a trip to China would be quicker. Fml, I'm sitting here waiting right now - it's been 50 mins. hopefully I'll get my food in 10 more.

update: 
actually turned out to take 75m to get dinner. 

however, I wanted to call out an injustice that I witnessed. they turned away a couple (Caucasian guy and girl) at 730p although they close at 9p, I thought this could be due to how terribly slow they are, but then right after they took in a group of people that consisted of 2 girls and 2 guys all Asian. I didn't think much of it until they turned away a second group with 2 Caucasian guys and one pleaded in mandarin to stay, saying "even me?". after they were turned away, another group of 2 girls 1 guy (all Asian) were let in not 2 mins after. from my point of view, this is f'd up.
author: Tony M.

description: Got to the spot was ready to order some good food and the service was terrible.I sat next to a man that looked like he been there for a while I thought he had ordered until 10 minutes later he walked out the restaurant. So the guy is working on a large take out order to go and I'm thinking he's going to get me right after, a couple walks in and five minutes later he takes their order, so I'm thinking he's going to take mine right after Not the case and he ends up taking their order to the back and that's when I made my decision to get the hell up out. F'up my whole lunch I rather spend my money with folks that'll at acknowledge you rather than folks that don't give a shit.
author: 88 G.

description:
I made the mistake of not calling SO before heading over. When they were closed I made the second mistake of the day and settled for Henry's next door. 

Don't make the same mistake!

Service was pretty horrible when we needed to ask for small plates and utensils to eat the food we had ordered. On top of that, employees were blatantly on their phones every second they weren't actually working. 

Lastly, the combo chow mein I had was so oily I picked out the chicken and shrimp bits and just ate that.
author: Leina K.

description:
What's wrong with this location's management?!!  Do you really not care about local business unless it is your secret and special membership. You're tarnishing the rest of the locations' reputation because you're terrible.
We called in a dinner phone order. You said you had no appetizers. You said at 5:30 pm on Friday it would be 45 minutes for 2 dishes.  When we arrived 45 minutes later, you said it would be 15 minutes.  You weren't even busy.
SO restaurant next door had our take out order ready in 10 minutes, and their food was delicious and their service was excellent.  And, next door restaurant was fully packed, but still didn't disappoint. Your HORRIBLE, and this hasn't been the first time.  
May I suggest you change your name for this location to avoid tarnishing the Henry Hunan's name. You seem not to care about attracting new customers or even keeping the local ones who try to patronage you. Thanks for introducing to us to SO by way of us realizing your lack of service was unacceptable and walking out. Right next door they know how to run a restaurant ... it's a shame you can't follow their example or your other locations'!!!!!
author: WI O.

description:
Very popular amongst Chinese young tech workers in the SOMA area.  The price is cheap and the Chinese menu can get you some reasonably authentic home dishes (given that SF doesn't really have good Hunan restaurants).

Pros:
1. Portion size is good for the price, especially so for SOMA
2. Shiso-based Hunan dishes are a rare find in the U.S.
3. For those searching exotic meat, there are frog legs & rabbit meat

Cons:
1. Some pork slices tasted VERY off and not fresh. It's not unusual trying to hide poor quality meat within spicy dishes. For things such as stir fry pork w. pepper (农家小炒肉), even though the chile peppers are supposed to be the star, the off-tasting pork/bacon was distracting and quite offensive. This is scary considering that this is the dish which almost every table orders (high turnover). Who knows what may be the case for dishes that are ordered less frequently.
2. Food lacks complexity, even the supposedly Chinese dishes such as Stir Fry pork w. Pepper (农家小炒肉) is quite bland. They use serrano, which is somewhat spicy, but not quite up there for authentic Hunan taste. Wish they add the also some of the readily available bird's eye chilis for extra spiciness, but whatever.

If you do come during weekdays for dinner, then try to reserve ahead of time. They can get quite busy during dinner.


-----
Update: 
I'm pretty sure my friend & I got food poisoned here. 

昨晚吃的辣椒炒肉，吃的时候就觉得好像肉坏了，肚子一晚上不舒服，今早还得请假，我勒个去
author: Adam X.

description: I see that lots of people complain about the wait. But the reason is that they only have a few chefs in the kitchen. My friend is from Hunan, and she confirms that this Is As Close As it gets to the authentic Hunan cuisine. The restaurant tried to hired some more chefs in the past, but the taste won't be the same, so instead they went back the old way, longer wait, but better taste. The food can be quite spicy, so be prepared. If you wanna skip the wait, either go early, or order ahead. You can place your order when you make an reservation, or order for pickup.
author: Emily L.

description: Couldn't get a table on a Friday evening after waiting for 40 minutes. No turnovers; everyone hogging tables on their cell phones. Don't go alone; they'll seat groups ahead of you. Wait staff not particularly helpful.
author: John D.

description:
Henry's Hunan catered an event at 111 Minna for me...and the food + service + price was AMAZING. 

Frank was so helpful, there on the day of, hand delivering the fresh food. 

He was able to come up with a menu to accommodate even the pickiest of eaters. Gluten free options, vegetarian, and dairy free. Everyone was raving about the food. 

Highly recommend.
author: Nanette R.

description:
This place used to be great.  But I go back recently and many things are taken off the menu.  They dont even have the chili oil anymore.  Plus, there is always a worker out front smoking.  Not only do you have to wade through his smokey breathy smoke to even get in the place, whenever anyone opens the door all of the smokey smoke breath wafts in.  

Pass.
author: Terd F.

description:
What a **** is this? I was just so mad about the service. Kind in a rush to go to the gym and ordered one dish for myself. ONLY ONE DISH!!! And I waited almost like 50 min. Is that crazy????

When I asked the waitress why my order took so slow but just got the answer that I must wait until all the tables ordered before me to be fully served. There happened to be one table with 10+ people before me and ordered tons of food. Then I have to wait until all their food served!!! For ONE DISH, I have to wait like 50 minutes. This totally drove me crazy. 

I just want to say that it is just so ridiculous to run a restaurant in this way. I will never come back again even though the food is not bad!
author: Feng W.

description:
Ordered from grubhub, came 30 mins late. Had chicken fried rice, chicken chow mein and orange chicken. 

The only thing enjoyable was the chicken fried rice. The chow mein had little taste, and full of grease.  The orange chicken was super soggy. 

Will not be ordering from this establishment ever again.
author: Teal M.

description: the taste is good, the wait is really really long. Just 3 dishes, wait about 40mins. At the end you don't know if it is delicious because of you are starving or it really is good. I drop by the kitchen, there seams only one chef cooking. 3 waitress, one is lying loosely in sofa, one smoking outside, the other one wanting for serving. The waitress told us that chef cook table by table, which means if there is 10 people table before you, the wait could be hours?
author: Gigi W.

description:
Slooowwwww service and they don't appear to give an ef*

Haven't tasted the food yet bc we have been just sitting here forever waiting on 2 to go dishes. The only redeeming quality is almost everyone here (patrons, workers) are speaking Mandarin so come here if you are studying Chinese and want the exposure
author: yamam B.

description:
Best authentic Chinese spicy food in the Bay Area!!! Must try if one wants to experience real Chinese food. Exactly what I ate during childhood in Hunan, China. 
The only complaint is long waiting time during peak hours. I would suggest come in the afternoon between 3 and 5pm.
author: Emerson X.

description: This place SUCKS! no ice, no soy sauce, shitty food and completely disgusting and dirty! If I dont get get sick after this lunch I'll be amazed!
author: Brian D.

description: Food is ok not very authentic, at a dirty alley and it fits American's taste probably, if you don't Hunan good you have to know they have one of hottest chilly but here you don't get spicy enough even if you ask for it
author: Alex Z.

description: The Chinese-only menu has the most authentic Hunan food in the bay area. Probably the spiciest too. The english menu's not bad either.
author: Changbai L.

description: worst service I have ever had. What was worse is the hygiene condition, the glass they put on our table had a lipstick mark left on it! This is insane!!!
author: Catherine L.

description: Slow and chaotic. We waited one hour only to find out the servers forgot to place our order. Then we waited another half hour, the food was still not ready. During that hour and half of waiting, the severs were hanging out with their friends, eating and drinking. Yes! They were drinking with their friends while working. The cashier was negligent and was unapologetic about forgetting to place our order. They even gave us attitude when we inquired about our order!
author: Xue C.

description: What can i say... came at 5:30... 1 hour later... still waiting for my food... service is TERRIBLE... when we asked how long is that gonna be... they said still a long time as most people before you still didnt get the dish... i just got my white rice. If you need to wait 1.5 just to get the food... no matter how authentic it is. Thats just not worth it...
author: Nataly S.

description:
I've been to Henry's Hunan twice and they have two different menus. An English and a Chinese menu. 

The English menu has regular chinese food you can find anywhere. The Chinese menu has a combination of things that I didn't know how to read.

The food was awful the first time. I felt like everything was a big goop of randomness and it lacked flavor and salt. I didn't know what I was eating.

The second time (came with my friend who knew what to order), the food was good. We ordered gizzard, shredded beef, and pork slices which were spicy and addictive with lots of bell peppers, celery, chilis, and jalapenos.

I was confused by the two different experiences. What is going on?? We'll probably stick with going with our friend who knows how to order with the Chinese Menu in the future. 

If you can read Chinese, try this place out. If not, I would pass on this.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
Last place on earth to eat at.

Having frequented the other Henry's locations, I assumed (incorrectly) they had their formula down.  Not the case.  This was probably the most worst experience eating in San Francisco in 15 years.  I could go on and on (and others have it appears) but no need.  This place was filthy, the conditions in the kitchen were deplorable, the service was the worst I have ever experienced and it ended up taking over one hour to get our LUNCH order.  More people walked out after we sat than received their order!  Orders were brought out with no relationship to time sat, everyone was absolutely ignored and they processed a ridiculously large togo order in the middle of the lunch rush.

Henry Hunan's normally means great, authentic Hunan food.  This was disgusting, bland, over cooked.

They did not even have the Henry's black bean sauce and offered sriracha sauce and old soy sauce packets!

Close please
author: chris l.

description:
If I could give them zero stars, I would. Such terrible service. My two friends and I ordered our food. Our appetizers come out 20 mins after. And we're starving but willing to wait. About another 20 mins after that we're starting to get hangry and we get up to ask our server how long our food were going to take. She replies back and says it's going to be another half hour to an hour because they have a huge group of people coming in and they need to serve the group food before serving us food. But that once that party has been served, they'll get started on our food. What. The. F***! We ask her to clarify and she just says it's going to be a long wait because the other group needs to be served first. 

First of all, what the hell. 

Second of all, why couldn't you fcking tell us that we were going to have to wait so long and wait until the group coming in after us has been served, before we can be served our food? How does that make any sense? Should've told us that from the very start!

Last of all, don't go there if you want people to know what "common sense / courtesy" means. She didn't even apologize but asked us to pay for our appetizers instead. Wtf to the max.
author: Chia X.

description: I have not eaten at Henrys for at least a year, though I work 1 block away.  All of the stories of ridiculous waits and rude managers are true.  And they have been CLOSED BY THE HEALTH DEPT since early Sept.
author: Ross K.

description:
The food ate was maybe 2 or 3 stars, but based on service, like many other recent reviewers I wish I could give zero stars. A friend and I wandered here for lunch on a Saturday, and it took over an hour for our food to come out. We watched each dish slowly trickle out of the kitchen, one by one, incredibly slowly. I guess they cannot make more than one dish at a time? When we politely asked the waiter to check on the status of our food (which, by the way, I don't think we would have been able to do without my friend who speaks fluent Mandarin), she strolled into the kitchen, came back and told us there were two more dishes ahead of us. No urgency, no apologies.

On our way out, a couple of diners looked at us and said, "The first time and the last time we're going here." I felt the same way.
author: Sidney L.

description:
Where shall I begin?  I'll start with positive aspects, how about that?

1st.  Easy to find as it is directly across from the Benz dealership.  Parking is reasonably easy to find; we went there during Friday rush hour at 530pm.  The place was fairly empty at that time so we were seated quickly and were able to put in our order in a fashion.

2nd.  We ordered spare ribs, chicken gizzards, and "bo cai."  All were tasty and delicious.  The pictures you see on Yelp are representative.  Some look very homemade but the taste is great.

Now for the other aspects.

The owners have no idea how to run a restaurant.  I feel bad for the 2 older women cooks I saw in the kitchen.  They make a great meal.  I'll give them that but their kitchen is literally run like a home kitchen.  It's like when you were young and you shouted out to mom to cook up your favorite dishes for dinner and she did it.  These ladies have very little prep in the back as far as I could see when I stuck my head into the kitchen.  They are literally making everything from scratch as the orders come in.  THIS WOULD ACCOUNT FOR THE VERY LONG WAIT TIMES that everyone has mentioned on Yelp.  They are literally working dishes one at a time.  Add to the fact that have of their food is stored / refrigerated outside the kitchen downstairs or in the front of house which has the cooks running back and forth...now you've got a recipe for ultimate time warp.  We literally waited 1 hour for our 3 dishes.  When asked why a larger group of guests who came after us received their food much sooner than us, the reason was because they called ahead to order.  (another Yelper had this happen to them as well)

The front of house.

The waitresses were fine.  Not rude.  They do their best.  Give them a break.  They are just study abroad students who do not really know the etiquette because they are not getting the guidance from their bosses.

The manager / boss / owner or whatever was there the whole time.  You could it was him because of his demeanor.  Plus he walked to the back of the restaurant and brought out some expensive looking Chinese rice wine to drink with his friends at a table behind us.  He makes no effort to ensure speed of execution.  No effort to acknowledge his customers and to see how they are doing.  He doesn't take any orders and doesn't seem to care that food service is happening today or the food is coming out tomorrow.

Although the food is excellent, this place has many issues in terms of expediting and front of house.  And at ~$50 for those 3 dishes at dinner time with a wait time of ~1 hour...um, there are many other options in SF to satisfy your stomach.  These managers / owners need to realize "So's" is literally RIGHT NEXT DOOR.  If they can fix these issues, they will do well.  Otherwise, the rising rent of SF will do them in because in the almost 2 hours we spent there, I only saw ONE table get turned over from 5-7pm during almost peak dinner time on a Friday.  Mind you that when we left the restaurant, it was almost full with one long table of 16 being reserved no doubt for their called in pre-order group which would get precedence over any walk-in's later.  The capacity is ~50-60 people.

In conclusion, I really want to like this place.  I really want to sample more of their food.  But the wait time is absolutely ridiculous.  The guy at the next table literally ran out of laptop power, smart phone power, and resorted to good ole fashion magazine reading during his wait.  So if you literally have NOTHING to do and don't mind waiting an eternity, come here.  Bring your phone, bring your reading material...but not your appetite initially.  Make sure you give your stomach about 30-45 minutes of pre-hungry time before arriving...or else you might just forget you were hungry!

So I give it 2 stars...only because of the food.  If it were not for the taste, it would be well....use your imagination....
author: Cary L.

description: This place would serve me, or at least said it was a 30-45 minute plate for one dish, 15 minutes after they open. Very unfriendly and unprofessional, and not willing to serve me unless I was willing to wait, with nobody currently eating in the restaurant. This place should not be open if they discriminate, as they were taking orders from 3-4 other people but didn't say anything about a wait. I will never go back to this location. A few doors down us a great Chinese place call "So" that was excellent.
author: Chris H.

description:
We're very excited to try this place. Our last office was close to another location and we're all fans of spicy food.

Came into this restaurant today for the first time. We ordered and the wait began at about 12:15pm. 

At 1pm, after quite a while after ordering, we began to wonder if our food was coming. Two other tables had been seated and received their food since.

After they apologized, the meal finally started to come out at 1:10 -- one dish at a time, extremely hot. It seemed that didn't even start until almost an hour after receiving our order.

It was disappointing as I had to leave before even eating due to work schedule. I heard the food was pretty good.
author: William D.

description:
Best Hunan food in bay area. 

I was born in Hunan, China and spent my first 18 years there. Since I came to U.S. 3 years ago I've never found an authentic Hunan restaurant like how Henry's is. The owners are amazing at cooking Hunan food. The food tastes exactly the same as what I could have in the hometown. The pickled pepper beef even goes beyond many local restaurants in Hunan. 

You probably have seen negative reviews about this place. They are probably true but let me tell you my trick. 
 - Go for dinner, when they have less traffic. :)
 - Don't look at the menu but ask for the "special" menu. My favorites dishes include the picked pepper beef, fried pork with pepper, and pork with smoked bean curd. 
 - only ask for spicy if you are REALLY good at it. 

Best luck and enjoy the food!
author: Huayang G.

description:
Horrendously slow.  Was told it'd be a ~30 min wait for lunch.  Waited over an hour.  I would have stayed if they would have given me tea or even a word that they didn't forget, but got absolutely nothing.

To top it all off, 2 groups that came in after me got their food already.
author: ninpou k.

description:
Great food. Fast service. Extremely polarizing reviews. Note that they have a chinese menu that has dishes not on the english menu. We got 2 dishes recommend by another reviewers (a guy from hunan) beef with peppers, egg with peppers. 

Beef has good sauce, extremely spicy. I like more spice than most people and i had to take some of the peppers out.

I was wary of an egg dish for dinner but it's shockingly good. More egg flavor than other eggs somehow, not spicy compared to beef.

I have never seen a place with as many 5 star AND 1 star reviews. All the 1 stars seem to be about service, our food came out in under 10 minutes. Our waiteess was nice, and according to my wife very helpful.

Addendum: Came back and got the egg thing along with a pork belly dish. Eggs and bacon for dinner. 10/10
author: J D.

description: Went for lunch, early, and put in our order before the place filled up.  Waited 50mins for our food, which came after a party of 8+ got their food, when they arrived well after we (3 of us) had our orders taken.  Got the food to go and tipped two dollars for them having even completed the order...  Eating the Mongolian Beef now, and it's too salty.   Makes it seem like they rushed our 50min dishes.  If we're going to wait that long, it better be good.  Shouldn't have tipped at all.
author: Justin L.

description: Forever wait. Waited almost an hour for a single dish of fried rice. And it tastes just ok.
author: Howard Y.

description: Bad service, and environment is also bad. Servers seem to be arrogant, and it took over 1 hour to get only 4 dishes.
author: Winston Y.

description: The food is amazing, but the service is incredibly slow. Don't expect to eat within a normal lunch break. Also, in recent months, the menu has a lot of redacted items. My favorite ten, their hot and sour soup, has been permanently removed.
author: Marcus B.

description:
This place prepares authentic home-style Chinese cooking. I spent 2 months in a village in China and this food is on par or better. The food can be as spicy or not spicy as you like, provided you are not spice intolerant. This all comes from the "secret" menu. If you can speak but not read Chinese they will help you navigate the menu, and are especially friendly to non-native Chinese speakers.

All this said, know that Friday and Saturday evenings can be very busy. Also I can't speak for their English menu because I don't care for Americanized Chinese food.
author: Marc V.

description:
I have stayed in U.S. for 8 years. And it is THE BEST (not one of the best) homemade Hunan style Chinese food I had so far. 

The food come slow but it worth waiting, specially you like spicy Chinese food. If you like typical sweet and sour American Chinese food, this place is not suggested.
author: Richie D.

description:
I LOL'd that they had a "People love us on Yelp!" sticker on their front windows.  Yeah right.  People love their OTHER restaurants on Yelp! is more like it.

Don't bother coming here for lunch.

The place is depressing and so unlike their restaurant on Natoma.  

Vibe I got from the servers were like they were serving out a prison sentence.

Food took 40 minutes to come out.  Seriously.  At lunch.  I was a party of one ordering off the lunch menu, not some special dishes for a party of 10.

No place settings on the table..  Had to ask for a napkin because there were none.

Felt like I was eating a funeral parlor.

Never again.  Natoma all the way.  Not even in the same ballpark.
author: Darren C.

description:
Easily my favorite restaurant in Bay Area featuring spicy food! I have been here countless times and brought many friends who love spicy food here! Never had I been disappointed. 

If you are ordering from the printed menu, you are doing it wrong. Jason(the owner) always keeps his daily menu on a handwritten piece of paper. So if you want the real deal, looking at the right menu would be step one.

I normally go for 
小炒肉/牛肉，spicy minced pork/beef
辣椒炒蛋，eggs with pepper
辣炒鸡胗，spicy chicken gizzards
苦瓜炒蛋，bitter melon with eggs
啤酒鸭，beer duck
蒜香骨，garlic ribs
剁椒鱼，fish with pepper

It is the best if you can go with someone who's able to read Chinese and understand authentic Hunan cuisine flavors.

Every time I come here, I sweat my ass off, and steam comes out of my head. 
Oh boy, just think about the experience made me feel like Pavlov's dog now...

However, your experience largely depends on what you order and if you love Hunan spiciness.
author: Cheng C.

description: I said for one person.  The fucker said no.  Clearly there was a seat there.  He said he is too busy.  I wouldn't go here.  Service is soooo bad.  One word "discrimination".
author: Francis A.

description: Used to be a great place, frequented it for 10+ years. Food is probably still good, assuming you manage to place an order. I would recommend you visit the Church location instead for an all around better experience.
author: Chris B.

description: 1st timer here and wow! What a let down! Read reviews and saw that it would be a good idea to call in a order because of how slow the service is. 1:15 phone order for beef and string beans over rice. Only one order to go mind you. "20 mins, come and pick up". COOL! Not bad, I get there at 1:40... 20 more mins, still not ready. 2:05, finally get my beef and string beans over rice! Walk back to the office and open the bag, mmmm smells good, open the container... WTF! (Wendy's commercial pops in my head) Where's the BEEF!? Not worth my time to go back and be a jerk... Oh well, you win some and you lose some.
author: Manny D.

description: We went there yesterday and was Very Disappointed. We usually go to Hunan on Sansome St. off Boardway and Love the Food and Service but they're close on weekends. From the time we entered we were not welcome and had to ask for menus after seated. We started ordering and immediately was told the item was not being served. We ordered something else and again was told it was not being served. Finally there was an item that was being served and after the 3rd food item the waitress said that would be enough when we're use to ordering several items and sampling each plate. My mom being 92 we didn't want to drive her around for something else. The simplest thing as sodas (sprite) they were completely out. The food was salty and came out slowly one at time. Being Filipino I noticed the items that we tried to order but was told it was not being served was actually served to another table across the room to a group of Chinese couples. Chinese couples that entered the restaurant after we were seated received their food before we did. The restaurant was small enough that I can actually see what was served to that table. We were DISAPPOINTED and STRONGLY do NOT Recommend Eating at this Restaurant.
author: Victor V.

description: Great place if you're native Chinese. Food is great and authentic Hunan. Make sure you go with your Chinese friends because there's a Chinese only menu that has the authentic dishes.
author: Eric Z.

description:
As a person from Hunan, I'm highly recommended this restaurant! Even though the decoration is not that good, the flavor& feeling is soooo "Chinese" and Hunan. 

FYI. They have some dish which is very authentic you should make a reservation in advance.
author: Yvonne L.
N L.

description:
**Disclaimer: Big fan of ethnic hole-in-the-walls so I'm used with okay to bad service. As long as the food is bomb, I can overcome it.


Stopped by Henry's since SO was closed next door. I usually see a line out of Henry's so I decided it was the next best option. Found a table for me and my buddy. 

We were seated fairly quickly and got menus. Took a few minutes to order and started chatting with the table next to us. They ordered a spicy dish too hot too handle, so they kindly offered us some while we waited for ours. Friendly atmosphere, right?

However 10 minutes became 30 minutes, and soon close to 45 minutes ... we were getting impatient. I tried waving down a couple of waitresses but they made eye contact and ignored me. Our food finally arrived: Henry's Special, Shredded Pork w/ Veggies, and steamed rice. 

Henry's Special 7.5/10
Shredded Pork 4/10 (pork smelled rancid)
Steamed rice: It's steamed rice -- just tasted a bit dry. 

Decent food but the wait won't have me coming back. There were 3 empty tables around us you can't say the place was packed. Also, there were people walking in the kitchen and out, having cigarettes, and slamming beers. Hard to tell who worked there and who didn't ...

I also spoke to a regular there. She said the wait is usually that long, and you usually have to call ahead and sometimes order ahead. Kind of ridiculous.
author: Tee T.

description: Racist racist racist. If you Chinese you get service here. If not you ain't. Plus they were chopping things in a dirty and unsanitary room near the bathroom. Go elsewhere this place is the dumps!
author: P D.

description: This place is an absolute horror. I got one word for you. COCKROACH.
author: Michael P.

description:
I found it, guys! The restaurant with the worst service in the entire world! Incredible. I wanted to take my (now ex) friends to lunch so we walked down the block to Henry's Hunan. We were tempted to go to SO right next door, but I've had a terrible service experience there as well.

We sit down and 10 minutes later they bring us menus. Another 30 minutes go by before we have to wave a server down so they'll take our order.

I'll save you some time: It took them 1.5 hours to bring us: sweet and sour chicken, kung pow chicken and fried rice - all of which was probably cooked in a microwave.

My friends broke up with me on the way back to the office.
author: Joshua I.

description: Worst service ever. Sat down and ordered, waited for 30 mins or longer. We saw 2 large tables came in after us all had a full table of foods, so we asked why ours was so slow. The waiter said "they had reservations". Really? Even when it comes to bringing food to the table? We asked him to check on our food and he said "it's not ready". We said in that case we would like to go some place else, he said "sure it's up to you". I will never come back to this place.
author: A J.

description: Foods cheap, but just alright. Service is extremely slow. If you're in the area, go to SO instead.
author: Liz Y.

description:
Worst experience ever.

We sat down and ordered food. Waited out for 30 mins. Nothing happened. Asked for when the food is ready. They go "don't get inpatient", "those folks sitting there waited for two hours for food and they don't complain", "really? Nobody told u guys it would take at least one hour for food?". Finally had some food, but not the food we ordered. No apologies. 

Never coming back again.
author: Li L.

description:
Called and ordered two dishes: pork and frog. We were craving for the frog, so we were willing to wait for an hour. But when we came and picked up the dishes, they made pork and something else. And told us that we didn't order frog. And the manager was super rude, no apologize or anything. 

This restaurant is super slow (avg wait after order is 45 mins). when you done in. When you order pick up, they just mess up your order. 

Will never eat here again.
author: violet s.

description:
Henry's Special (bomb)
Hot Sour Beef (bomb X2)
Onion Cake (skip)
Diana's Special Meat Pie (oh yes!)
Dry-sauteed String Beans (Divine)
Dumpling's (yup, I'll have 2 orders)

Location kinda sucks and so does parking but way worth it!
author: Carla F.

description: The best Hunan food in Bay Area.
author: Huahan Z.

description:
Seriously, what did I do to piss this restaurant off??  I honestly don't know but I must have.

Anyway, here's what happened.  This place is a neighborhood joint and I already went there once and it was ok.  Here are the subsequent visits:

Visit #1:  Placed an order via phone.  Was told it'll be 35 mins.  Ok, showed up 40 mins later - they said I must have called the wrong restaurant because they couldn't find my order in the kitchen.   Ah, no, I showed them the call log on my phone.  They tried to blame me still, "You didn't call us and that's why we missed your order, it is YOUR fault! Sorry."  But how do you expand your phone number in my call log?  "Sorry, it is your fault."  I then asked how long will it take if place an order now?  "One hour."  Seriously??  Walked out.

Visit #2:  Not really an actually visit but I called them and tried to place an order.  
HH:  It will take A Hour and a Half, do you still want to order?
Me:   Come again?
HH:  One hour and a half wait, do you still want?
Me:  But you guys close in an hour.....
HH:  Do you want or not?
Me:  Hell no.

Visit: #3:
Me:  How long is the wait this time?
HH:  15 minutes.
Me:  Cool, give me a large hot and sour soup.
HH:  Sorry, we don't have soup.
Me:  Huh?
HH:  No soup today.
Me:  It's only 5:30 pm and you're out of soup?
HH:  Yes.

This can't be all coincidence.   I don't know what it is, but somebody at HH is mad at me.  Oh well, I guess I'll have to go somewhere else; it's for the best.
.
author: Sammy P.

description:
I live nearby, and for many years this was my go-to place for great Chinese takeout when I'm in my SF place.  Unfortunately, the quality and the service have been noticeably declining for a long time, which is weird, since the same owners have a number of other restaurants around the city that seem to still be as good as ever.

Recently, I've had long waits for take-out food, after I'd phoned ahead and arrived at around when they'd told me the food would be ready.  Tonight, I couldn't get them to answer the phone at all, but according to their website, they were open.  The answering machine was full, too, so I don't think it was an isolated incident.  This particular restaurant must a really bad manager at the moment; if you want this food (which is quite good), go to another one of their locations.
author: Lawrence S.

description: Came in 815pm. Half of the restaurant is empty. Only one waitress. I Order one simple dish- pepper fry egg. Now is 845pm. But My dish is still not ready. It appeared this restaurant needs more staffs.
author: Fangfang O.

description:
I was going to give it one star since I waited 20 minutes in an empty room for service. 2 other people walked in and we're served before me. But then I got the food.....man, I had to rate better even though the service continued to be horrendous.
Advice? Don't be in a hurry when you go to eat there. But the food...is awesome
author: Kym M.

description:
I've been going to various Henry's since 1975.  They are uniformly good, fast and cheap and this one used to be no exception.

Went in for lunch with a former coworker a couple of weeks back.  Sat at a table. 10 minutes later moved to another table. 10 minutes later order was taken. 10 minutes later plates were brought. 20 minutes later no food.  Had to go to a meeting, so we cancelled our order. My former coworker said "F&*ing noodes shouldn't take so long.  And the guy said "F**k you:" as we left. Nice.
author: Darien W.

description:
This a review of my first and only visit to this restaurant.

I was really looking forward to this place. I went at around noon and ordered the chicken and Napa cabbage w/ a side of brown rice. 30 minutes later my food had still not come, and I'd heard nothing back from any of the wait staff. I asked where my food was, and the waiter ran back to kitchen to check on my food.

5 minutes later, my food comes out, with white rice. I had to remind the waiter that I'd ordered brown rice. The dish itself was the most hacked together, bland, and mediocre "chicken in brown sauce" concoction I'd had in a while. It was the sort of dish you'd expect at some americo-chinese cafe owned by rednecks in the middle of Idaho. Hella unimpressive. Ugh.

I really had high hopes for this place, and I suspect my experience was a one-off due to the clueless and oblivious waitstaff not having their sh*t together. I'm going to try the other locations: hopefully my experience there won't be as retarded.
author: Steve Y.

description: Would have gave zero star to the customer service if I could. For the past 8 years living in San Francisco, I have never encountered a restaurant the customer service as awful as this one. The twice I visited here, I averagely waited for more than 50 mins for foods to come out. I was told by one of the waiters arrogantly and somewhat proudly that the averagely waiting time is over 45 mins. The two waitresses seem hate their job being a waiter and serving people. I haven't seen one smile lit up on their faces all the time. The last time I cancelled my order after a 70 mins waiting, even though I called half an hour ago for reservation. The taste is actually okay and plenty of parking, but I'm not coming back again.
author: Robert C.

description: My friend from Hunan told us that he would drive every two weeks with his girlfriend to have food here from sj. So when we were tired and hungry and desperate for some authentic chinese food, he suggested here. You can reserve for a table and order online here. Spicy food were awesome!
author: Chang L.

description: They had nothing in stock.  Almost every dish we wanted they said sorry no have.  Horrible service.  The staff just does not care about service.  Will never come back here ever again.
author: Konala-Xingmei L.

description: The food is amazing if you love spicy.  However, like what other people mentioned, the wait time after ordering the food is so long~~~~~~~~~~  I waited about 70 mins, AFTER I ordered the food.  This is so different from all the other Chinese restaurants.
author: Jack L.

description: Authentic Hunan style, and cheap! Some might be too spicy, 紫苏黄瓜很好。
author: Jianfei H.

description:
This place is a legit hole in the wall hunan chinese joint. LEGIT. Owners, employees, everything is 100% chinese from the motherland. Even the dirtiness and flies in the bathroom. Yuck. 

The food is blessed with hella hunan spices and will make your poop come out like lava. I had the unfortunate experience of exploding hunan poop several times the next morning (I had it for dinner). I expected it since the place isn't the cleanest. I can't imagine what the kitchen looks like if the bathroom was filled with dead flies on the wall. 

I'll probably be back cause the food is on point hunan but I'll definitely keep my schedule open in the morning next time.
author: Dennis C.

description:
Slow (super) service, low key presentation of food, but quite tasty. Of course you need to order their special daily menu, which is not written down. Always ask the waiter/waitress what they have for the day, most of the stuff on it are quite authentic and tasty.

Try:
- stir-fried pig ears
- frog with pickles
- beef pancacke: this is funny, with cheese and lettuce in it and a crunch face. It feels like a Chinese-Mexican fusion, kind of Chinese quesadilla?
author: Tian W.

description: Stay away. As hard as this is to believe You can sit at the table and they will look at you and not bother to take your order. This has happened twice now and I'll be damned if I go back.
author: john k.

description: Best hole in the wall Chinese food in the city. We have not had a dish we have not liked. Friendly staff and quick to go service. Seriously if you have not eaten here you gotta try it. We love the meat pie and chicken chow mein. A good kept secret in the city. There are three locations. We go to the natomas location.
author: Melodie C.

description:
If this the first or second tine I won't say a thing.
But this is absolutely unacceptable that each time it takes more than 90mins to get my takeout while they  tell me it only takes 40.
This would be my last time ever.
author: Qiming L.

description:
OH MY this place is AMAZING!!!
We tried green pepper fried egg, catfish soup and beer duck. I cannot believe how can the chef make fried egg, such a simple dish, so delicious.

To those who gave this place only one star: It's not wise to order spring rolls at such an authentic Chinese food restaurant. It's like ordering pizza in a sushi bar or asking for Chinese fried rice in an Italian restaurant. If you really want spring rolls or General Tso' chicken, please go to Panda Express.
author: Chenguang W.

description:
I don't think the owner really cares about the business or the customers. Their target is probably Chinese people who learn abt this place from their friends. It's probably a side business for the owner. 

The food is good if u want legit Chinese spicy food. You should definitely call ahead to order or u will end up waiting for hours. They prepare dish one at a time. There is no efficiency at all here. If u come after a large party.. Well sucks for u..

Think twice before u come.. Or just call..
author: Heaven C.

description:
With the current "cold" weather, I thought I try my best to make this review "Hot" and "Spicy"!

Whenever I worked nearby, this restaurant is one of my lunch spots. I've had every item in the menu and the food is good. The owners and workers always give me the royal treatment. I come here with a big appetite and leave with a happy face. 

Yesterday, I was here for lunch and ordered the Kung Pao Chicken. For $8.00, I get a plate of diced chicken with Red Chilli Peppers, diced Water Chestnuts, scallions and their own blend of spice to challenge my taste-buds. I also get a fat bowl of rice with my meal. 

And these guys know I love my dishes "extra spicy". So spicy, I was perspiring continously. The most perfect meal to spice up the holiday season. 

Paid with my Mastercard for my lunch.
author: Matt G.

description:
Came here around 11:50 am and ordered to go.

Got country vegetables which consisted of stirfried cabbage, carrots and tofu. It was what I expected so I was content

Got the curry chicken without bell peppers. They use white meat so that was different for me . But it was also good

Both needed rice to balance out the flavors. 

Only had to wait 8 min from when I ordered so It was a good experience .

I would come back for the meat pie.
author: DOM d.

description:
Okay, a bit of clarification for those that aren't in the know. There are many Henry's Hunan's throughout the City. I've eaten at all of them but the one in Noe Valley. This is not a chain. This is a family. One brother owns this one, another brother owns this one, this one is owned by an uncle - you get the gist. In fact, I was talking to the guy at the other SOMA location - the one on Natoma, which was closest to one of my last jobs - many years ago and he was telling me which family members owned which ones and how many other family members worked there. I didn't memorize it.

Another caveat: I had my rehearsal dinner at this location, on October 30, 1998. My mother picked up the tab, just as she had for my sister's rehearsal dinner. I told them how many people to expect, I ordered a bunch of stuff off the menu, I told them to add any other dishes they thought would be good, which they did, and the food was hot and ready when we showed up. My mom paid about a third that she paid for the chain restaurant for my sister's dinner, and we had leftovers. I said, it's nothing fancy, but everyone said oh-my-god-that-was-so-good.

The decor is not exquisite at any location, though I like the space at the one on Natoma. I worry about this particular location, because it never seems busy, although I think they do a considerable amount of takeout. My husband in conversation one time (we used to get lots of takeout when we lived South of Market) with one of the Giants fans who works there told my spouse that the clubhouse manager was always stopping by to get takeout before games. I hope that's still true.

So this last weekend we stopped in. It was a nearly empty restaurant on the first official Saturday of Chinese New Year. Our guy was limping as badly as my husband (they exchanged notes later). I was a little uncertain. But my three favorite dishes - Diana's special meat pie, the chicken salad, and Henry's special - were all still as good as I remembered. That's right. They tasted right, something that's difficult to do across so many restaurants across so many years in a picky-ass restaurant mecca like SF. Well, when you do something well... Our food tasted right, tasted good, and we were all happier people suddenly.

There was something monumentally satisfying about the whole experience. Since the whole unemployment-pregnancy-move-to-Oakland thing, I haven't been in a Henry's Hunan since some time in 2008. And the guy at this restaurant, the one with the limp, said to me: You used to go to the South of Market one at lunch, right? That's the one owned by my uncle. Uh, yeah - all the time. A couple of times a week, usually after 1 or 2. And I'd stop by in the early evening and get takeout. And he remembered?!!

Maybe you can go home again.
author: Ingrid J.

description:
This place has great, reliable Chinese food. I go here frequently -- it's a block away from where I work. 

Prices are decent, and portions are good. It's often very crowded, but you can usually find a table. Only thing to be concerned about: sometimes longer than usual wait times for food during the lunch hour.  

For vegetarians, I strongly recommend their dish called "Chinese Green," which is basically steamed bok choy in a delicious garlic sauce.
author: Michael M.

description: I've been here twice -- sat down, ordered food, then waited 30 - 45 minutes.   The food has been good when it arrived, but the wait after ordering is just too long.  Unless the management can hire more or quicker cooks I won't be back.
author: John R.

description:
I actually stumbled upon Henry's Hunan because SO was closed randomly one day. It's got some authentic Hunan food and also Americanized Chinese food for people who enjoy either! So I usually hate tofu, but my friend ordered it -- and it was quite good! I consider that a feat in itself. I got the sweet and sour chicken, which was kind of fried first with a sweet and sour sauce drenched on top... Yummy and a little more unique!

Service was fine, and atmosphere isn't too special. Not necessarily the safest place late at night though.
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
If you only want some apparently good food but do not care of your own dignity - come here. 

I had my first attempt to dine here, but I can't stand the condescending attitude and constant ignorance of the waiters/manager of this restaurant.

We came in and were seated. Order taken quickly but we were told to wait 40 minutes - FINE, a lot of popular restaurants are like that.


First shock came 20min later. Another table vacated, and that's a corner table. We were asked if we want to move there - OF COURSE. Then ridiculous thing happened - a Mexican couple who came in 5min ago were seated at our old table immediately after we were moved to the better table. I'm not trying to extend too much - but I'm Asian, my friend is Asian. The look from the Mexican couple was like "why the f they were treated better". I have read similar discriminative treatment in other reviews...

Then 40 minutes passed - no food. 60 minutes passed - no food. To me, it's ok if you can't provide food as you promised - everyone in the world slips on their set timeline. But no explanation. And even worse, we called the waitors with the attempt to get explanation - what we received is ignorance - like we were vacuum.


At this moment, the Mexican couple who came 20 min later than us got their dishes (multiple dishes). I don't know what's going on there. 

We made a decision - LEAVE. We want food, but we also want to be treated with respect.

Funny thing - when I stood up, a young waitor finally realized we are leaving - and said in mandarin "those guys just leave like this?" Honestly, kiddo, with all the ignorance and lack of respect of your guests time, you don't deserve an explanation from me, just like you don't think we deserve an explanation from you why the food is nowhere after 70minutes of waiting.
author: Charles S.

description: I am from Hunan and I am thrilled to find this place. This Henry's Hunan has secret menu that represent a very authentic taste of my hometown. It almost made me cry. Whenever my parents were visiting me, I brought them here. Love the food! Be sure if you can handle the food, cause it is very spicy ;)
author: Jessica Z.

description:
