Seriously though. Have the Meat Pie and Hot and Sour Beef - two hours later you will have the most glorious, wonderful itis ever. I happened to be at work at the time, but it's okay because I work for a startup and we're cool like that.
author: Nik B.

description:
Unfortunately for Henry, I am back on the free wifi in the jury assembly room with plenty of time to review the mediocre lunch I just ate .  Very limited lunch menu.  I wish I was more adventurous with it, but sliced beef and smoked ham didn't sound appetizing.

I ordered a kung pao dish, which had tough meat but good veggies.  Everything was way too salty, including the free soup.

They have a nice waitstaff, doing the best they can.
author: Amy D.

description:
This place is always packed during the lunch hour on weekdays!  Both times I've come, I wasn't able to get back to work on time and had to go over my hour for lunch.  The servers are actually really busy, and I see them running around, so it's not for lack of trying.  It's just that they don't have enough people for soooo many customers at lunch.  I actually eat in about 15 minutes or less, so the rest of my lunch hour is spent walking there and back(10 minutes each way), waiting for the food(20 minutes) and ordering/paying for the bill(10 minutes).

My low rating isn't for the wait time or service though.  While the wait time is super long, it's because they're one of the only options for Chinese in the area, and they're super cheap (lunch specials run from $6 to $8).  The service is actually pretty decent.  The poor waiters are always scurrying around to try to help all of the customers.  The rating is for the food itself...I just feel that the ingredients seem to lack flavor.  I got the kung pao shrimp once, and the shrimp didn't have much taste besides the taste of the sauce.  Plus, it was chopped up rather than being whole pieces, which was a turn off.  It just tasted like the shrimp had been frozen for too long and lost all of it's natural flavor.  I also got the combination chow mein, and once again, the beef and chicken didn't have much taste, besides the flavor from the sauces.  Both dishes were mediocre, if not disappointing.  I do like that they provide a free hot and sour soup with the lunch though.
author: Tyler C.

description: I love henry's - this one is pretty inconsistent.  Plus is that every item can be a lunch special/rice plate.  Minus- sometimes the soup is watery and nasty, sometimes awesome.  I usually get the hot and sour vegetables, which is sometimes great.  sometimes the rice is soggy and the sauce not so good.  decor is very cheap.
author: David G.

description:
In brief, the worst restaurant to which I have ever been. Obligatory "if I could give zero/negative stars..." remark. I wouldn't go back unless I lost a bet.

After learning that next-door Fanny's (now replaced by So) was closed down, my coworkers convinced me to settle for Henry's Hunan. Lisa W's review of Fruit Loops orange chicken rang in my head.

I'm convinced that the orange chicken is a menu trap to play upon unsuspecting people brought up on Panda Express' bastardization of Chinese food. Do you remember eating orange Flintstones vitamins as a kid? If you forgot, orange chicken from Henry's Hunan tastes exactly like them! It was so unspeakably disgusting, I couldn't finish the only bite I took. I had the rest boxed up just so I could show my roommates how awful it was.

My coworker pitied me and shared some of his Hunan spare ribs with me, which tasted soapy, for lack of better words. When he ordered a Coke, he was handed a can and glass. Sure it was lunchtime, but this place was hardly busy. Would it have killed our waiter to fill the glass? To add insult to injury, despite the fact that there was American Express marketing near the cashier, I couldn't pay with American Express! No tip.

I hope that next-door So drives this place out of business!
author: Cam S.

description:
I'd love it if people added an extra comment to their review which specifies if I should I go out of my way to visit a given place.

In this case, I drove down to Henry's with a friend and was disappointed.  The food was ok, if you like eating Chinese take out from the yellow book pages after bible dipping in a strangely appointed dinning space next to the freeway - I guess that's just not my thing.  With all the great (or at least good) Chinese places: Eric's, Alice's, etc. - I just don't know why I'd choose this one.  If you happening to be walking by for lunch.... sure, but as for making an effort to visit - I wouldn't.
author: Jared F.

description:
I am addicted to Henry and his gang of dragons in his kitchen.  I went to lunch at the Natoma Henry's for Lunch with some buddies, and one of them called me out for dinner at the Bryant Henry's the same day.  I accepted the challenge and we hit it up.  

It was our first time attending this location so I had to roll with my Henry Flexi-FIt cap to show them I was legit.  It was pretty empty, but the hostess was really nice.  Friendly faces from the Natoma location recognized us so we rapped about the Bryant location.  The chef from Natoma was working there for dinner.

We had the dumplings, Kung Pao Chicken, and Henry's Short Ribs (first time dish).  Dumplings were pleasant as usual. The Kung Pao Chicken was hella good and extra spicy.  We thought it was possibly the best Kung Pao Chicken we have had at any Henry's location.  The short ribs took some time to eat, but was definitely tasty.  

We survived back to back Henry outings in the same day with no problems.  I highly recommend it.  We didn't even need to use the sink faucet that hangs above one of the tables against the wall to shower off the sweat from the spice.

Seems like this is very popular for takeout/delivery.  It was pretty quiet. Also, it is popular for slirkers to pop in and try to get free food.  Some dude came in and asked how much coca cola was and after he found out it was a buck fifty he left, but not without grabbing a handful of food from the plate of a customer who left.  Another dude came in a bought a carton of rice.  Just rice.
author: Nate B.

description:
I was walking on the opposite side of the street and I could smell the awesomeness.

nice waiter/host.

only problem....the handle on the togo carton made the thing singe in the microwave.....
doh.
author: M M.

description:
TWO WORDS GOOD N SPICEY!!!! lol If you want some spicey chinese food, this is the place. I order the chicken curry and it's soooo good. You can taste that curry and the crunchiness of the bell peppers and onions. I took an order home to my hubbie and he loved it.

This place is real popular and very busy during lunch time...you should call your order in instead of having to wait 15-20 minutes.
author: Chantie G.

description:
The spicy garlic chicken dish I had was just what I was looking for. My wife had the shrimp tofu dish and enjoyed it as well. 

No frills as far as the ambient qualities are concerned. Kind of a plain jane establishment. 

The service was pleasant. 

Overall not bad for 7 bucks.
author: Gene G.

description:
Smoked pork, fermented black beans, and green beans = one happy Yelper. There's nothing Earth-shattering here, but it's good solid Hunan fare. The waiters remember us betwixt visits and the spice hits the spot.

Rec's: spicy fried cod, smoked ham with green beans, Marty's special, mapo tofu (with respect to Jade, I like it), dry braised green beans, onion cake, and the complimentary hot and sour soup is pretty darned tasty. Henry's is a dependable SOMA lunch destination.
author: Mark W.

description: I would give this place ZERO stars if that were an option. The hot and sour soup was so salty and yeasty that I couldn't force it down. I had one spoonful and I thought I was going to vomit. The beef with broccoli tasted like watered down horse shit. I have no idea how this place is still in business. I mean....how the hell can you fuck up Chinese food this badly? Stay away.
author: Babys P.

description:
I am very disappointed now.  I have been going to this location for the past 5 years or so and have liked it, though noticed inconsistencies for the last year and a half.  Tonight was the worse and I may not go back. I ordered Henrys Special pork, usually good, but tonight the spinach was about 90% stems and although I like to eat the entire leaf (and stem) this was too much.  The fried rice does not have the depth of flavor that it used to.  Furthermore, when I mentioned this, they didn't care.  Finally, before I paid my bill they gave me a dollar off.  Thanks, I promised not to spend it in one place.  If they are listening, it is difficult to get to your restaurant now and I worked to get there.  I don't deserve second best.  

They even acknowledged the lack of spinach leaf but why didn't they say something.  Time to move on.....
author: David M.

description:
Simply the best in the city. No foo foo frills. Just delicious food!
I actually think they put crack in their curry sauce. I walk around all week thinking about Henry's curry chicken.
FYI.-If you are a Henry's virgin, start with the Hot and Sour Chicken.
If I lived elsewhere I'd make someone go to Henry's to get me some food and put it in one of those vacuum-packing food sealer things and mail it off to me.
author: SF N.

description:
I want to give Henry a fourth star. Service was great - host was friendly, and he had no problem with me running to Trader Joe's while they made my food. And the menu had quite a few good looking items, including chicken with string beans, which was labeled the healthy option. Sounded promising, and when I asked for it to be made without oil, there was no hesitation what so ever.

Now I can't say this for certain, but I'm pretty sure my dish was loaded with oil. It was also loaded with chicken, which was awesome, but there is no way something that tasty and smothered in some questionable sauce wasn't overloaded with unnecessary oil. I guess I'll never know, but the suspect nature of what was in my white takeout box limits me to only three stars.

Henry, buddy, if you can refute this, send a shout! Fourth star is waiting.
author: Jason B.

description:
The food is definitely oily and saltier than before...what the hell happened Henry? LOL!

THis place use to be good, now I don't go here anymore...that sucks! The Diane's meat pie is good as usual, but the dishes I use to order ain't spicy anymore! Big disappointment!

Parking is always hard, what do u expect...it's in the city!
author: Marc E.

description: I come here for lunch twice a week. Different style of Chinese food with the great service and low price. Love this place!
author: Byung K.

description: I've tried a few dishes, but the best thing on the menu to me is Dinah's meat pie. I use to go to the one on Natomas and was shocked to realize there was another one so close to my job on Brannan.
author: Barbara W.

description: I must say, Good food! (oh well still eating as I'm writing this review) ,  Tried their "SPICY & HOT ROCK COD FILLET" and it was a dynamite. Interesting mix of flavors with just a right kick of hotness!. Would not mind trying other stuff next time.
author: Rajesh S.

description: This place is awesome! Yes, like the other reviewers said they will make your spicy stuff spiiiicy. I'm weak when it comes to that but my friends loved it. I wasn't expecting much from here due to its location. Seriously one of those middle-of-nowhere-but-good-as-hell restaurants. If you want authenticity in some Chinese gourmet at decent prices you should check this place out.
author: Lily L.

description:
Been going to Henry Hunans for lunch for years. Was one of my favorite places to eat in the city, plus the staff was very friendly and efficient. But Henry Hunan's is under different ownership now, and the experience is very poor.

Went yesterday and noticed that there seemed to be new staff. Tried the hot and sour soup, was bland and watery. Had Pork Chow Mein, tasteless. Orange chicken also disappointed.

Service was horrible even though the place was only 1/3 full. Asked for chopsticks 3 times before I ended up getting them myself. First two dishes served 5 minutes before the third dish and rice. One of the waiters also started yelling at his 7 year old daughter right in front of our table.

In all, poor service, poor food. Will not visit again.
author: Mike C.

description: Seriously, we may be ruined for other Chinese food and we have been to China and live in the other best Asian food capital of the US, Seattle. We got to Henry's on a recommendation from a friend from SF who still dreams about Henry's. He gave us the menu musts of Dianes Meat Pie, Hot and Sour Chicken, and anything off the smoked menu so we got Marty's Special. AMAZING!!!! This location has little to recommend for ambience but the freshness and depth of flavors in the food is amazing. It's also cheap, clean and in a safe neighorhood.
author: L R.

description: I've seen lots of reviews about this place. However, I was very disappointed at the food when my office took us there. All the food was drenched in salt and they all have the same color. You can get much better Chinese food and not worry about your blood pressure by walking a few blocks towards Chinatown.
author: Yi-Bing Z.

description:
I have been going to the Henry's on Bryant St. for years. It was definitely a popular place among all the locals. Unfortunately, I was shocked when I went this week to find out that it appears that this Henry's is under new ownership.

The service was absolutely awful and none of the food tasted the same. The soup was different, and not in a good way, the orange chicken was way too orangy, and the chow mein had almost no flavor.

I hate to say this, but I will not be going back to this Henry's and I would suggest you avoid it as well. Time to find a new Chinese restaurant...

Update: Just found out that Jeff, who used to run this location, started a new restaurant over in Noe Valley: http://www.yelp.com/biz/henrys-hunan-jeff-and-eddies-san-francisco
author: Daniel D.

description:
bad food. but the server was super nice. but bad food
I went here cus SO was closed 12/31 LOL

ill tell u what NOT to get:

the hot and sour soup2/5
sauteed eggplant 3/5
fried rice (no taste) 2/5
onion cake 0/5
liling chicken wings 1/5

these were the dishes we got.
author: Cindy L.

description: Don't know why I haven't reviewed Henry's sooner...  I've been eating here for years...  first at the Sacto St. location but now the Soma spot as my office moved.  I absolutely love Henry's!  The food is always fresh and delicious.  Some of my favorites are Harvest pork, Henry's special, meat pie, cold noodle salad, the list goes on and on.  They have a large menu selection that you can check out on line.  You can order your entree mild, medium or hot.  This is not health food people, it's Hunan at its finest.  Go, eat and enjoy.
author: Brenda G.

description:
this place is always packed during lunch rush hours...its better if you just do take out rather than dine in.
now, im not much into eggplant, but i tell every eggplant lover to try their eggplant dish here because its AMAZING! its spicy, cooked just  to the right consistency, and it melts in your mouth with the flavor of ground pork.
every dish ive had here was exceptional!  if you love spicy food and looking for something more substantial than the typical salad, this place would be a great option!
author: Anthro Food E.

description: Delicious chicken salad and fabulous chicken chow mein.  On the dinner menu the bean curd with the spicy meat sauce is very good too.  One of my friends couldn't handle the spicyness though.  That's OK.  If you let your waiter know the spicyness of the foods can be toned down to suit your taste.  Excellent service too!
author: Sara A.

description:
One time, Eddie, the head guy at the Natoma St. place, randomly gave me a replacement turn-signal mount for my motorcycle, which I was missing. Now that's service. 

I like Henry's. Not every day, but it's yummy and fun to go there with a big group of coworkers for lunch. At dinner time (yes, they seem to actually be open for dinner) it's empty but still tasty.
author: queue q.

description: Delicious items on the menu.  Start with the Diana's Special, as it's a fun appetizer in groups of 3 or more...or just your fat self.  If you're not allergic to seafood (travesty), have the cod.  The fried rice is also tastey.  The only thing I think they should improve is that there's too much salt in their dishes.  Well, what can you expect?  It is Hunan!
author: Michael B.

description: Great Hot and Sour Soup...very spicy!
author: Diane R.

description: I had lunch here today and I must say that this place has come along way since it's inception years ago. If you have a spicy appetite for traditional chinese, this is definitely your place. The hot spot dishes for me was the mongolian beef, and the hunan cashew chicken. You will need to bask in a bangload of water and steamed rice in order not to melt your throat from the chili pepper in just about every dish they have...!!!! The lunch specials are fairly priced considering the quality of the food is excellent and flavorful...! In case of emergency, dunk head in cold water..!
author: Sven S.

description: I've eaten here about a half dozen times now and for me it's damn good Hunan!  The owners are very friendly and heck makes the best dumplings  in town...always fresh as you see him or other staff making them - simply yummy.  I like spicy so if you like Chinese on the hot end check this joint out.  Odd location, and very dive-ish, but heck, again - it's the food that brings me back.
author: Tiberius A.

description: I love spicy food and they bring it.  I got their Henry special and it was enough for two people and had chicken, scallops, shrimp, woodear mushrooms, lots of other veggies and spicy sauce...yum!  Not a romantic place...only had lunch downstairs (not sure what upstairs is like) but good for lunch with coworkers.
author: Jill D.

description:
Food is great here.  It definitely fits the taste bud of a person straight off the boat or a person who is relatively picky in terms of ethnic foods.  

Great service, staff is very attentive and tend to remember their clients after only a few visits. Large and spacious, I think you'll enjoy the food here any time of the day.
author: Prince B.

description: Hot, cheap & greasy...just like I like my men...mmmm!
author: Colleen B.

description: This place is damn tasty, and if you like it hot they will oblige.  Perfect for those long booze addled nights of drinking in SOMA.
author: George K.

description:
NASTY.  

Went there because it was within walking distance for lunch.  Bad Idea.

Ordered some chicken, beans and noodles.  Greasy and bland.

We would have been better off going to McDonalds next to the 850 Bryant-and that says a lot.
author: anthony l.

description: Huge surprise - live just around the corner, and never knew how good this place was until a week ago. Really interesting menu, a mix of stuff you've seen before and stuff you haven't. Everything is delicious and unique. My new go-to Chinese spot!
author: Nicolas C.

description: This place has a HUGE menu and big tables for big Friday-afternoon-lets -get-the-heck-out-of-the-office lunches.  BUUUUUTTTTTT it also has huge lines/waits and the food, while good, is no better than any other decent Chinese place in the neighborhood.  Only worth it if you have a giant group that won't fit elsewhere.
author: Jason S.

description: Friendly staff, pretty good Chinese food. The sweet and sour beef was very tasty.  Orange chicken would have been better if I had ordered spicy. I got mild and it was a bit bland for me.  The hot and sour soup is really good.  The decor is pretty basic but clean (for a Chinese restaurant).  I can see this place being a regular lunch spot. If only they would deliver . . .
author: Su K.

description: I'm not sure why this place is rated so high on yelp, it has steered me the wrong way.  It was very disappointing, greasy, cheap chinese food for not so cheap prices.
author: Debbie Y.

description: While I prefer the Minna and original Sansome locations, this place has the best family-run-business atmosphere.  Random location across from Bed Bath and Boring/Trader Joe's mall at Bryant and Ninth St.  Recommended dishes: hot/sour chicken; Henry's special; green beans without meat.  Only complaint is that rice is sometimes past its prime.  Dishes themselves are amazingly hot and fresh and truly as spicy as requested.  The other day my friend and I stopped for a late lunch here on the way to a movie downtown.  Easy on-street parking early afternoon on the weekend.  Even got free very spicy hot and sour soup with chicken stock which was a great appetizer.
author: Xander S.

description: I had the Chow Mein, and the dumplings, and both were great. Tons of food- and the service was impersonal, but efficient.
author: Danielle V.

description:
this is one of my favorite chinese restaurant s in the SOMA.  the meat taco like thing (what is it called?i forgot); shrimp fried rice; and beef and broccoli are my favorites. the service is fast and the meal is mad cheap.  this place gets pretty packed at lunch time but i think u can make reservations. whenever we have a large party, we always ask to reserve our spot at the rear of the restaurant. 
prepare to have food coma when you get back to the office.
author: Bren L.

description: Pretty good but rice was not great.  We had the chicken and broccoli which I enjoyed but my wife was not crazy about and the kung pao shrimp which she liked.
author: Patrick Z.

description: Huge portions, but very oily.  The pricing is good and cheap.  The Meat Pie is pretty awesome, I would give that a 4 star.  Everything else is alright.
author: Peter W.

description:
Henry's is the place I was introduced to Kung Pao Tofu the way it should be (in my mind, not they way it was supposed to be) - really spicy. 

Whenever I get a craving for really really spicy food with hot peppers (and oil), I simply call in and get an order of the kung pao tofu. 

Apart from spicy, the food is nothing much to write about. Its standard fare. Service is good. However, its quite oily (regardless of whether I request to cut the oil).
author: Rahul A.

description: Great for lunch.  Doesn't offer the typical crappy chinese food menu, which is refreshing.  Though some dishes are pretty one-dimensional in flavor.  Favorites are the eggplant salad and cold spicy noodles.
author: Kasima T.

description:
better to take out than to eat there, as the decor is borrowed from the hall of justice just down the block.  

if you can't handle super spicy food, you better order mild, as that is still as spicy as most conventional spicy Chinese food.

very fresh, very tasty, very good with pilsener beer (I suggest Lagunitas Pils or Sudwerk Pils).  Get yur ya ya's out!
author: Ken H.

description:
This place is a great place to grab a quick bite.  My friend works at the Hall of Justice and we have lunch here every so often.    The prices are reasonable but the portions are small compared to other hunan places.  

Their pork and beef dishes are great.
author: kenny l.

description: I've been here twice -- the food is great, and the price is right.  The owner is also very personable.  This is officially my go-to place when I'm craving Chinese...
author: Kevin V.

description: OK everybody in my office love Henry's.  I think they are too spicy and too similar taste nothing special other than too hot.
author: C T.

description: Henry's Hunan is a small chain of restaurants at different locations throughout the city.  The food is consistent and the prices is reasonable!  Tonight, I ordered my favorite dish, Shrimp with String Beans and steamed rice.  The shrimp is tender and the green beans are cooked just right- with a bit of a snap, not soggy.  If you get a chance to dine at any one of their locations, I highly recommend this combination.  The serving was enough for two, so come with a hungry appetite and bring your friends.  Great food for a great price.
author: Denny L.

description: The first time I tried Henry's Hunan was in the FD about a year ago.  I wasn't very impressed at that time, even though my colleagues loved this place.  I thought the food tasted like Panda Express or "Westernized" Chinese Food.  I am pretty picky when it comes to Chinese food.  However, much to my surprise when I decided to give it another try, this time, at the SOMA location -- it was pretty damn tasty.  The place in SOMA on Bryant is still a hole in the wall but the Spicy Sole Filet and String Beans were cooked just right and delicious.  I will definately be ordering take-out from here again when I'm craving some greasy Chinese food.
author: Janny J.

description:
My favorite dish here is the spicy fried cod.  Lots of black beans and very tasty.  The house made spiced ham is also great as well as the soups.  I like the spinach soup better than the hot and sour, though.  OK, I'm getting hungry just writing about it.

You will be hard pressed to find a more friendly server than Jeff, especially in a Chinese restaurant.  Good baseball fan.

Once you become a regular, you can get away with certain things.  For example, you may get  some of the entrees served over rice rather than having to order a whole entree.  That's great if you're dining alone or want to sample a dish without having to get the entire order.
author: Eddie C.

description: this place is very efficient.  i've only been here during lunch hours because i work right by it but its in and out.  no muss no fuss.  everything is hella cheap too, i usually spend about 8 bucks.  i love how spicy everything is too.  i leave with my mouth on fire. love the hot & sour soup with the onion cakes.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Food is still good, but went seriously downhill since Jeff left to open his restaurant on Church.  Now there is competition a few doors down too.
author: Bentley L.

description: tried their shrimp and green beans.  ordered it mild and it was still pretty darn spicy.  it was ok.  somewhat greasy.  not the best chinese i've had.  maybe i didn't order the right thing?
author: Melissa Y.

description: kungpao chicken , potstickers, hot sour beef just to name a few killers.
author: Rick H.

description: This is a great place to eat, my co-workers and I really like eating there. We must eat there once a week. There are several things that are very good.
author: David S.
